name: Priya Das
warning_signs: Decreased urine output or dark-colored urine
Severe swelling in legs, ankles, or face
follow_up_instructions: Schedule lab work for kidney function tests in 2 weeks
Attend dialysis sessions as scheduled (3 times per week)
Limit sodium intake to 2000mg per day
Weigh yourself daily and report sudden weight gain (>2 lbs in 24 hours)
Report any signs of infection immediately
discharge_summary:
Patient Priya Das was admitted on 2025-08-25 with Glomerulonephritis. 
During hospitalization, patient was managed with Sodium bicarbonate 650mg three times daily, Lisinopril 10mg daily, Atorvastatin 20mg at bedtime. 
Procedures performed included Hemodialysis catheter placement, Peritoneal dialysis catheter insertion, Ultrasound-guided kidney drainage.
Patient's condition improved and was stable at discharge. 
Discharged home with instructions to follow up with nephrologist and continue medications as prescribed. 
Patient educated on warning signs and dietary restrictions.
